s.text: A second set of controls, using culture water, should be included in the test.
A second set of controls, using culture water, should be included in the test.
The terms currently used to define the endpoints employed in the rapid, chronic and sub-chronic toxicity tests have been derived from the terms previously used for full life-cycle tests.
The DO concentration in the samples should be near saturation prior to use.
Toxicity test method used (title, number, source)
A second set of controls, using culture water, should be included in the test.
For example, data from concentrations above the NOEC for survival are included in determining ICp estimates using the Linear Interpolation Method.
Using these guidelines, the "normal" range of NOECs from toxicity tests using a 0.5 dilution factor (two-fold difference between adjacent concentrations), would be four-fold.
A second set of controls, using culture water, should be included in the test.
